senses.sense_definition: To run faster than and overtake someone or something.

examples.text: The greyhound managed to <w>outchase</w> the rabbit before it could reach the safety of its burrow.
He tried to <w>outchase</w> his pursuers through the winding streets but was eventually caught.

senses.sense_definition: To surpass someone in the act or skill of chasing.

examples.text: The experienced hunter could <w>outchase</w> any novice when tracking deer in the forest.
She determined to <w>outchase</w> her rivals in the pursuit of the championship title.
